name: Tuscany Suites & Casino

reviews.text: I just past a week as a guest, for a reduced budget this hotel is a plus, a big room with a huge bathroom, separate toilette, shower and a bathtub. A little kitchen with a microwave, with no utensils, quiet. A very friendly staff, very quick check in and out.
reviews.title: Budget plus
Great value
reviews.text: You must have a car, just from the street to your room you have to walk, but I have a car...
Very grateful finding, I am going back again.
reviews.title: Would stay again
Nice hotel near the strip
reviews.text: Stayed at the Tuscany Suites for a week (30th April) with a group of 13.
It was ideal for our group as the hotel is small compared to most in Vegas which meant that it was easy for us to meet up and bump into each other.
reviews.title: Great Rooms off the strip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three things that would improve my rating of this hotel:
reviews.title: 3rd stay - still good but...

reviews.text: 1 Get rid of the 'resort fee' and increase the quoted price if necessary
reviews.title: Tuscany Suites is a great hotel, second time staying there

reviews.text: 2 Extend the wireless internet to the rooms and increase price if necessary
reviews.title: Better now except..............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 Make the points (comps) earned on the players club card easy to use/spend and explain how at check in.
reviews.title: Fits The Bill Once Again (With A Few Hiccups)

reviews.text: In spite of these three negatives (and they do annoy) it is a great place to stay, close to the strip, big rooms and good facilities. Good for couples and families.
reviews.title: Wonderful place ! I recommend it !

reviews.text: The rooms are large and spacious. Their in house coffee shop is actually quite good, reasonably priced, and good portions. The casino is just plain bad. Nobody was winning anything. The machines are programmed very tight. The hotel is fine. The casino is not.
reviews.title: Bad Casino. Nice and quiet rooms.

reviews.text: I give them one star because the TripAdvisor.com claim all rooms have rollaway beds available. However, after I checked in and called the front desk for a rollaway bed, she told me that they cannot give us a rollaway bed because our room is a two double bed suite.
reviews.title: Rollaway beds not available. They lied.

reviews.text: Rates are low for a reason. Hidden fees abound as does bad attitude. One of their managers in particular, Tara Armstrong, aka "Tara-ist Armstronger," has no business in the hospitality business. She redefines its meaning to "hostility."
reviews.title: Avoid at any cost!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked online and got a great deal on this room, which was really spacious, well-maintained, clean, and nicely furnished. Staff was courteous, the bed was comfortable (great pillows!), and there were nice toiletries to use in the bathroom (none of the crappy tear-open packets of shampoo you sometimes get at other places). Most importantly, the air conditioner worked well and was quiet so we got some relief from the heat but were still able to sleep peacefully. We were actually just passing through rather than staying in Vegas, so I can't comment much on the location, but in terms of a nice, safe, clean place to stay, this was a great value.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value

reviews.text: We actually stayed here in August 2010 and finally getting around to writing this review.
reviews.title: Great, clean place! Much more for your $$!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great value for the money, rooms were clean and large. If you are looking for a quiet casino to learn at , this is your place. The walk from the strip to your room at 2pm is a little spooky but was safe , the area needs more lighting on the roadway, but over all we had a blast.
reviews.title: Great time had by all

reviews.text: I am a resident of Las Vegas and recently had my wedding at the Tuscany Chapel and reception dinner at Tuscany Gardens. Everything, EVERYTHING, was gorgeous and wonderful! The staff at the chapel really know how to coordinate a beautiful wedding - totally worry free. Not the cheesy "Vegas style" you hear about, but a beautiful, classy wedding.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!

reviews.text: As for the restaurant - Tuscany Gardens - my guests - all of whom were from out of state - are still RAVING a month later about the food, service and atmosphere. The manager of the restaurant was so very accommodating, patient and just first class in everything.
reviews.title: hidden costs

reviews.text: Also, most of my guests stayed at the Tuscany Hotel and everyone gave it a great approval rating. The rooms are spacious (like little apartments) and since it's a bit off the beaten path, you feel like you are at a resort and can get away from the 24 hour noise of the strip.
reviews.title: Warning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are thinking of getting married in Las Vegas, I highly suggest you take a look at the Tuscany. First Class all the way.
reviews.title: once again another great stay

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel Tuesday through Friday and it was the perfect location, not to close or far from the strip. Rooms in the H building are clean, spacious and close to the pool. Hotel is perfect for families because rooms are very spacious. Only down fall of this hotel is the resort fees they charge per night ($14.00 per day).
reviews.title: Good stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this stay. Location was good. Casino had everything we wanted...although we didn't win anything. Room was perfect. Nice place to stay for a very reasonable price. Would stay again.
reviews.title: It was just what we needed

reviews.text: We took all the kids on this trip so we wanted a place away from strip but not extremely far. We got just what we wanted here. I really liked the apartment feel of it. You dont have to walk through a smokey casino to get to your room. The buildings are sectioned off. So there wasnt really any traffic of people coming and going.
reviews.title: Great if you want to stay away from strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious almost like a studio. The whole setup was very accomodating. From the living area with the couch, coffee table and desk and chair. Also having the toilet seperate with its own door was a plus when traveling with multiple people. The sink was very much appreciated in the kitchen area. We didnt get to use the pool but it did look nice. Maybe next time.
reviews.title: Great price, huge room, right off strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great package deal with this hotel and blue man group. The grounds and hotel itself was very beautifully landscaped and nice looking. The room was spotless with new carpeting and a huge bathroom with a shower and tub. The room had a table with two chairs, a couch and chair with footrest, and a king bed. The bed looked lumpy, but it was very comfortable! It was the comforter that was lumpy. It didn't have that really refined designer look, but it was very nice. One huge bonus for me was that you could park your car right outside the door, then we took the elevator up, and there was our room! Some of the large hotel casinos require a mile walk just to get from your room to your car. The hotel had a very nice casino, and the restaurant, like the room, was clean and had good bones but could use a designer touch. The food was delicious! The service was the best we had anywhere in the three days we were there. They even gave us a 2 for 1 coupon to the restaurant on check-in. Like other reviewers mentioned, it was a nice quiet haven to relax in after the noise and bustle of the casinos. I will definitely go back! The kitchen area only had a coffee maker and a refrigerator, no microwave.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Tuscany for 11 nights. We were very comfortable for such a long visit as the rooms is very large and extremely clean. The furniture is dated and the walls and carpets are very dark, but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is very large with separate tub and shower in one area and a private area with toilet. There were tons of towels and shampoo and soap. The hotel needs to be remodeled, but the price would not have been as reasonable. We paid $422 total for 11 nights!
reviews.title: Nice Room and Grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino is pretty bad -- smoky, not many machines. Marilyn's Cafe has consistently good food. We ate there about four times, and each time the food was well made.
reviews.title: Not as bad as the reviews said

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The driveways and parking lots are well lit - and the pool was open in November. Most of the pools in other hotels were closed for the season. I used the weight room and it was okay.
reviews.title: Not As Good as Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, and I don't think you can beat the location. I have been to Las Vegas about 15 times in the last six years, and I don't remember ever being in such a convenient location -- if you have a car.
reviews.title: Loved It!

likes.disliked: — no eating utinsils in the room if you did want to cook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I decided to go to Vegas for his birthday. We stayed at the Tuscany Suites from June 6th - June 9th. We rented a car at the airport. It was a last minute decision and instead of paying the full rate, I had someone at home reserve a car for us through hotwire, saving us about 65%. Anyhow, the car ended up being a great idea as the hotel is about 3 loooooooong blocks from the strip. When we wanted to go to the strip we would park in the Hurrahs parking lot, its free.
reviews.title: Excellent value and large room

likes.liked: — Very good room at a low price

reviews.text: This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel. It's improved a bit since last year. I think the management has changed, and that's a good thing.
reviews.title: Improving, but the price is creeping up

reviews.text: In the rooms, they've given up on the kitchenette. That makes sense, because they never gave you pots, pans, dishes, or utensils. The bar sink, fridge, and microwave remain, as does the coffee pot.
reviews.title: Okay...
Excellent Choice!!
reviews.text: The empty space in the casino has been filled in with more stuff. The comedy club that was shuttered last year has been replaced with a poker room. They gave up on trying to do "shows" - noone comes to the Tuscany to see a show. There's a new sports bar with lots of TV's and friendly service.

reviews.title: Perfect Hide Away
reviews.text: There's $3 blackjack most of the time, although it's multiple deck. Cocktail service in the casino is spotty. Some people can get drinks, but I never seem to be able to.

reviews.title: Horrible Accomodations
reviews.text: The awful buffet line is gone from the coffee shop, and it's being replaced with a counter. The coffee shop has gotten a coat of paint. The service is spotty - most mornings, the breakfast crew was overwhelmed by the number of guests.

We flew into Vegas for our big national park family vaca. We wanted to show the kids the strips bright lights, catch a few Z's and get the heck out of sin city! Tuscany Inn was easy to find, affordable (yes there was a $14.50 extra fee for some tax..but stillva good deal). The room was huge and immaculate. The place is very pretty in general. We ate late night at Marilyns in house. Decent breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect for our family's brief trip thru Vegas!!!

reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone unless you really want to be in the heart of Vegas.
reviews.title: Didn't Get the Rooms That We Reserved... And They Were Unapologetic About It

reviews.text: First off, let me just warn anyone that might book this hotel through hotels.com or some other online discount broker... buyer beware. You might not get the room you reserve, and depending upon whom helps you once you get there, they will be unapologetic about it.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyable

reviews.text: I made two reservations at this hotel for the same night, requesting the same type of room. My extended family and I were passing through Vegas on our way to a wake and funeral that following Friday and Saturday. We took the bus in to save money, and it was running a couple hours late. No biggie. We had already booked our rooms for the night over a week prior, so we were looking forward to a hot shower and getting a good nights rest after traveling all day. Not much to ask of the Tuscany right ? WRONG!
reviews.title: Awesome place awesome people

reviews.text: It all started with the front desk clerk stating that the hotel is overbooked, so they wouldn't be able to fill our request of having adjoining rooms. Even though our reservations were made a good week prior, they couldn't make that happen? Okay. Then, he proceeds to give us two rooms that had 2 double beds in them, instead of the king bed suites with a sofa bed that we reserved online. Now that's a problem. Because I'm traveling with the kids, we have to give them one of the beds. Which only leave one scrawny double bed for my wife and I to share. Now we're no little individuals... together we're about 475-500 lbs. So this 1 double just aint gonna work.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, friendly staff, good food!

reviews.text: I have recently returned from staying at the Tuscany Suites for a week, and can say I thought it fantastic for the price. As it was so cheap I was expecting it to be either rather small, rather run down and the rooms a bit grotty!!!! However it was none of these things, the rooms were fantastic we got a room with 2 double beds in it (and there was only 2 of us) it was so big. If I had to struggle to find something negative to say it would be that there was no dishes or cutlery etc (but knew this anyway). The pool area was lovely, plenty of sun loungers, sun & shaded areas, jacuzzi was lovely!
reviews.title: Lovely accomodation
Nice hotel, terrible service
reviews.text: Again the only slight down side was that the hotel was a distance from the strip (although it was nearer than I thought it was going to be). I had read that it was just not quite walking distance to the strip. As someone who HATES walking it definately was walking distance, it took us about 15 minutes to get from our room (was at the back) up to Bally's (and I don't walk fast!!!)
I would definately recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Excellent deal for the price

reviews.text: We stayed at the Tuscany as part of a large group. Upon arrival at around 7PM we were told that we had no reservation. After supplying a valid confirmation number I was told that their computers crashed the day I made the reservation and they had no record of it. They did give us a room at the group rate we had been promised, but when I made the original reservation I requested two double beds because we had four people staying. The room they gave us was a king room and had a single bed. This is when the problems started. My wife called the front desk, was told that rooms are on a first come first served basis and there were no double rooms left. Although we had reserved two double beds we had not previously been "assigned" a room and therefore could not have a double room. They say this is standard practice; however others in our group that came after us were given double bed rooms. My wife then requested to talk to the night manager and was transferred to his voicemail. She hung up, called the front desk again and was greeted by the same employee who was laughing and carrying on a separate conversation. She explained that she was trying to contact the night manager and had just been transferred to his voicemail. The employee laughed and told her that the manager was right there and gave the phone to him.
reviews.title: Don't Understand the Hype

reviews.text: After some pressure the night manager said he would send us a rollaway bed. We complained that one rollaway would still leave one of our daughters to sleep on the floor. After he refused to do anything else for us and hung up I walked to the front desk (we were in one of the remote buildings, it was a long walk) to talk to the manager face to face. He then told us he'd be sending a "full size rollaway" but could not send two; it would be against fire code. When the rollaway arrived it was a twin size bed. When I called the front desk to complain they refused to answer the phone, I left it ringing for 10 minutes and no answer. I called from my cell phone, one ring to an operator, two rings to the front desk. Apparently they didn't care to talk to us. I was told that another bed would be sent immediately and would be in our room in 15 minutes. By this time it was after 8:30PM and my children were hungry. We waited 25 minutes then went to dinner. Upon returning from dinner around 10PM we found no bed had been delivered. Again I called the front desk, no answer. I walked to the front desk and was told that the bed was requested and would be requested again. At 10:30PM we received the second bed (and apparently violated fire code for the rest of our stay).
reviews.title: tuscany was tops!!!!

reviews.text: The room was huge, clean and comfy. Had all the amenities. Great location near the Strip, but in a quiet spot.
reviews.title: Loved it here!

likes.liked: — The huge rooms and the location

reviews.text: The only thing missing for us was a kiddie pool. The pool was too deep for my 3 year old to play in. But we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Family Stay

reviews.text: Just got back from our trip to Las Vegas, staying Sunday thru Thursday at the Tuscany Suites. We booked through tripres.com. Not sure I'd use them again. Would probably go right through hotel. The hotel puts a $60- deposit on each room on your credit card for incidentals, etc. We did get it all back later. This hotel is located on Flamingo Rd about 1- 1/2 blocks from the strip.
reviews.title: Great hotel outside the strip!

likes.liked: — big clean comfty rooms for a low price
likes.disliked: — no spoons,forks etc in the kitchen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tuscany is an all Suites hotel. But when you book, make sure and tell them exactly what you want. If you want a king size bed, or two doubles. Also specify if you need a microwave/cook top or not. I believe each room comes with a coffee maker and small refrigerator though. We had two double suites. I wanted a kind and a double, but apparently they are not located near one another, so I settled for doubles. I was told by (tripres) that 6 people could fit into suite. This is only correct if you get a king suite with a pull out couch and order for an additional fee a roll away. Roll-aways are not allowed in rooms that have 2 beds per NV law (?)
reviews.title: No Problems...just restful

likes.disliked: — Fan in bathroom area made too much noise.

reviews.text: Check in/out was rather quick as the desk has several agents working. Your room key gets you into the buildings and the pool area. Towels are provided. The rooms were both clean and contained 2 double beds, small breakfast table, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker. The toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom. The bathroom has stand up shower. Soaking tub. (nothing fancy, just a normal tub by itself. ) Nice size sink and vanity combo. Suite is somewhere around 500 sq feet.
reviews.title: Good Hotel at a Great Price

likes.liked: — The size of the room, and the pool.

reviews.title: Great hotel for the price!
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Tuscany several times because it is an absolute great hotel for the price. Although I think that more and more people are starting to discover it because it is often now booked on the weekends. This was not the case a little less than a year ago. Regardless, if you are on a budget and are able to get a room here, the rates are usually around $129 on weekends and between $39 - $59 during the week! I get those prices from travel sites like Expedia. The rooms are huge, clean, and nice. It feels more like a condo. than a hotel, so forget feeling that Vegas nostalgia while you're there. Still, well worth the money and very friendly as well. I am staying there again next week, my boyfriend and I are going to Vegas for Mardi Gras!

reviews.title: Clean & Great Atmosphere
reviews.text: My hubby and I stayed at the Tuscany from 2/4/06 through 2/8/06. We enjoyed every minute. It was superbowl weekend and the Strip was PACKED.It was very nice to be able to get away from the conjested feeling of the Strip. The Tuscany is close enough to walk to the Strip yet far enough away to be comfortable. We ate at the Steakhouse at Camelot in Excalibur, Smith and Wollensky and the Tuscany Gardens Restaurant (inside the Tuscany) and both my husband and I agreed that Tuscany Gardens had the best steak and the best prices! A couple of travelers commented that they couldn't understand the workers at the Tuscany and although alot of their accents are "thick" they were all EXTREMELY nice to us and went out of their ways to accomodate our needs. We will definately stay here again in the future!

Stayed at this resort, 2/3 - 2/5/06. Picked this place because I was staying with my mother and soon to be sister-in-law. Came up for the weekend to make wedding reception arrangements at Excalibur and to have a little fun. Didn't realize until after booking that it was Superbowl weekend....strip very crowded. This is a nice place, more resort looking with individual 3 story buildings. Reminded me of a timeshare. We arrived early from our flight about 9:30 am....asked if a room was available but fully expected to just check our stuff with valet until after 2pm. They had a room available. Unfortunately, it was in the "south 40" as the farthest building from the lobby, pool, casino... We didn't really care but when we got to the room the door wouldn't open. The light was green but no matter how hard we pushed it was like it was dead bolted from the inside. So we decided to hoof it back to the lobby. We told the front desk lady that the door wasn't opening and told her it was like someone might still be in there. She said that she would send security with us back to the room?!!!!!??? I told her that "no I dont' think so and that I shouldn't be subjected to confronting someone who might still be in the room"! In any case, we asked to be moved up closer to the lobby and that we would be back in the afternoon to check it. We walked to Ballys (strip)...not too bad for 2 blocks. Ballys had pretty loose slots. I hit $260 quarter jackpot...not too bad for the first 10 minutes I was there. After Bally's, Paris and Excalibur, we made our way back to the Tuscany to try and get our room. They were able to accomodate us in the "H" building, which is the one directly behind the pool and closest to lobby, resturants, bar and casino. We had a good view of the pool and grounds. Rooms very spacious. The room had 2 queens and was supposed to be a couch bed but wasn't so they sent up a roll away at no charge. There was a refrigerator and coffee maker but no microwave. I'm sure they would of sent one up if we asked because I think the rooms are supposed to have them. Since we only were here for 2 days, didn't bother asking. All in all, I would stay here again. Everyone very friendly except one of the girls at front desk and the lady working in gift shop. Oh, special mention to the two guys working the bar Friday night, you both were the best and we had fun sitting there.
reviews.title: Different
Friendly Casino Staff
reviews.text: Stayed at this casino/hotel January 2006. Casino staff were very friendly, especially at the black jack tables. Price of food in the 24 hour cafe was very reasonable. Rooms were large and clean except the shower had mold in the tile grout. There is no shuttle to the strip. Best to have a rental car. You could walk to the strip but it is two very long blocks away. We were on the first floor; could hear people walking and moving about on second floor. Suggest you request top floor so you won't have to deal with the noise. Reasonable price.

reviews.title: Easy Camping
reviews.text: Finally got around to writing the review now that it's post holiday. Accommodations were very nice. Staff try and make an effort to accommodate. Can't give excellent rating since this is not a full service hotel but it is well above average expectations for an extended stay type of hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there while in Vegas last week. Reasonable price and close enough to the strip. We actually had a great time there. We stayed at Ballys last year, and Ballys bed was more comfy, had room service, etc...but we also paid a whole lot more for Ballys. Our room at Tuscany was good size, the AC worked almost too well, I liked the tub and seperate shower. We ate at Marilyns Cafe and the Mexican cantina, and loved them both. We had great service, the prices are reasonable and the food was better than the cafe at Bally's!! We ate at Marilyn 3 times and at the mexican cafe twice. We really liked the slot selections, didn't win a whole lot but didn't lose it quickly either. The only drawbacks that we found were the very loud bathroom fan that has to be on when you're in the bathroom. (The toilet is in a seperate room off of where the tub and shower are, and the fan is in the toilet room). And we only got 4 or 5 channels on TV, but that wasn't too bad since we only watched before going to sleep. I'd stay here again, and would prefer it more than any of the huge hotels on the strip!
reviews.title: not bad at all!

likes.liked: — close to strip, selection of slots, quick check-out, good dining
likes.disliked: — loud bathroom fan, very few tv channels, could also hear people upstairs walking

reviews.text: We really loved Tuscanny Suites and would definatley book again.
reviews.title: Tuscanny suites was great

reviews.text: The rooms were large clean and comfortable. AC was good and kept the room cool, as the temperature was over 110 degree's some days. We were in block B wich was just near the front rd, handy to get to as it was right near reception and all the other facilitys.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

likes.liked: — awesome staff! they knew me by name!
likes.disliked: — not within walking distance from strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tuscanny gardens restaurant was fantastic and i would really recommend it, we went a couple of times, their steak and Lobster tail was fantastic, also i had the lamb chop's another night they were lovely. The restaurant is beautifully decorated ,very elegant and the staff were really nice. For a top class restaurant the prices were quite reasonable
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay
Great Place and Location
reviews.text: Marilyns cafe was great to, we had breakfast there nearly every morning, we thought it was really good value for money plenty to choose from, and the portions were quite big, there pancakes and maple syrup were yummy all the staff were lovely.

description: All suite hotel with Italian decor, catering to leisure and business travelers - 3 minutes from The Strip.
